section.title: Installing FLOW3
section.para: (if you have the requirements up and running. Otherwise see below...)
add virtual host to public folder (http://flow3/ for this documentation)
if you don't have virtual hosts for some reason, you might also use localhost/flow3/whatever, though this is not recommended
As you see, the main action is to get the server running as long as PHP 5.3 is not stable. You'll find detailled descriptions on how to do that in the sections below.
Tip: Configuration of the cache to C:\t\1\ on windows because of the long filenames
Tip: If you see the XAMPP-default-page after calling the uri, you might forgot to add the port-number to the uri.

section.title: Setup Eclipse PDT for PHP 5.3
section.para: PHP 5.3 introduced the support of namespaces. This is a completly new syntax in PHP which is not yet supported by (most?) editors. Even the stable version of Eclipse PDT doesn't support namespaces syntax. So you have to install some nightly build, if you don't want to see all those red syntax-error-symbols in your php-files.
